issue.title: [Python] pip install tensorflow install too new numpy in manylinux1 build
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-3535](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3535). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
This blocks us from doing a release again. We definitely need to get this split apart before we do another release.

`[~pcmoritz]` `[~robertnishihara]`

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3535?focusedCommentId=16651745) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
Currently this installs 1.15.2 thus making this also our minimal NumPy version.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3535?focusedCommentId=16720341) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
`[~xhochy]` what would you like to do here for 0.12?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3535?focusedCommentId=16730310) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
We have pinned tensorflow to 1.1.0, that should suffice to keep numpy stable.
